citation:Producer.producer:Name: Preconception and Pregnancy in Inflammatory Bowel Disease Clinical Research Program

citation:Description.dsDescription:Text: This study aims to answer the question: why do some women flare during pregnancy, while others go into remission?  It looks at changes in cytokines and the immune profile during pregnancy in women with IBD, comparing longitudinal changes by IBD disease types and disease activity, and comparing this to healthy volunteers. As well, outcomes, like preterm delivery, are tracked.

ore:describes.socialscience:Collection Mode: Self-administered questionnaire: Paper; Physical measurements and tests;
ore:describes.socialscience:Frequency: Blood samples were collected at preconception, in each trimester of pregnancy, and cord blood will be collected at birth. Blood samples are also collected if enrolled patients visit the clinic at any point due to flaring or other related issues.
ore:describes.Title: Immunological Profiling
Related Datasets: Effects of Maternal IBD and IBD Breast Milk on Neonatal Gut Microbiome and Intestinal Inflammation
Elevated Fecal Calprotectin in the Second or Third Trimester of Pregnancy Predicts Preterm Delivery in Women with IBD
ore:describes.socialscience:Sampling Procedure: 30 study participants were chosen as the sample size so as to have 10 women with Crone's disease, 10 with ulcerative colitis, and 10 healthy controls.
ore:describes.Subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
ore:describes.socialscience:Universe: Adult women with IBD enrolled in the Preconception and Pregnancy in IBD clinic and healthy volunteers.
ore:describes.schema:name: Immunological Profiling
ore:describes.dvcore:conditions: Access to deidentified data may be permitted for external researchers, with limitations. Only researchers with REB-approved projects may be permitted access to the deidentified data. A basic data sharing agreement form is required (ie. Agree to not attempt to re-identify the records so as to relate the information on the file to a particular person). The data producer determines access on a case-by-case basis. Contact the data producer directly to discuss terms and conditions of access.

dvcore:fileTermsOfAccess.dvcore:availabilityStatus: Data is not available because the study is still recruiting.

ore:describes.schema:includedInDataCatalog: Women and Children's Health Research Institute (WCHRI)

ore:aggregates.schema:description: "Inflammatory Cytokines Change during Pregnancy in Women with IBD" poster presentation. The presentation contains aggregate data tables.
ore:aggregates.schema:name: Huang ECCO Cytokines Presentation March 2016.pdf
